page.title: 15 Local Churches.
page.content: The administration of the church reflects the history of the area. Dixton Church dates from Celtic times and was dedicated to St.Peter in Norman times.Situated on the banks of the river Wye,the church was subjected to flooding in 1929,1947 and 1960.The living is held by Rev.B.Phillips who also is responsible for the nearby parish of Wyesham.Services are at 8.00 a.m.(Holy Communion) and 11.00a.m. (Matins). In 1902 Dixton was allowed to vote to return to the Diocese of Hereford.Saint Cenedlan Church,Rockfield is also in the Diocese of Hereford although both are in the Welsh County of Gwent. However,St. John's Church in the Buckholt is within the Diocese of Llandaf.Whether Church of England or Church of Wales,all services are held in English.
